tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This psalm is a prayer for help.
"This is for the director of music to use in worship"
"people should play stringed instruments with this song"
This may refer to a style of music. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:032:001|32:1]]
people from the city of Ziph in the Judean mountains, southeast of Hebron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Does David not hide himself with us?
tn.text: This question is used to show that this is something important that Saul should know. AT: "David is hiding himself with us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Save me, God, by your name
tn.text: Here God's name represents his character. It may represent specifically his power or his justice. AT: "Save me, God, by your power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Judging David here represents showing people that David is not guilty. When God uses his might to save David,  people will know that God has judged him as not guilty.  AT: "In  your might, show people that I am not guilty" or "Show people that I am not guilty by using your power to rescue me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Giving one's ear represents listening. AT: "listen to the words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This expression represents what the speaker says. AT: "my words" or "what I am saying to you"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Rising up against someone represents preparing to attack him or actually attacking him. AT: "have prepared to attack me" or "are attacking me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"men who have no mercy"
Seeking after someone's life represents trying to kill him. AT: "have tried to kill me" or "want to kill me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they have not set God before them
tn.text: Setting God before them represents paying attention to God. AT: "they do not pay attention to God" or "they ignore God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Defending David and keeping him safe is spoken of as upholding or supporting him. AT: "who defends me" or "who keeps me safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: He will repay my enemies with evil
tn.text: Punishment is spoken as if it were payment. AT: "He will do the evil to my enemies that they have done to me" or "He will cause the evil that my enemies have done to me to be done to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here David changes from talking about God to talking to God. AT: "God, destroy them because you are faithful to me"

tn.ref: I will give thanks to your name, Yahweh, for it is good
tn.text: Yahweh's name represents him. AT: "I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, for you are good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The eye represents the person. AT: "I have looked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: my eye has looked in triumph on my enemies
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) seeing that his enemies have been defeated. AT: "I have seen that my enemies have been defeated" or 2) defeating his enemies. AT: "I have defeated my enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
